concept_data.title: United Nations Conference on Environment and Development
concept_data.preferred_term: UN Conference on Environment and Development

summary: The "United Nations Conference on Environment and Development," commonly referred to as the "UN Conference on Environment and Development," represents a pivotal event in international environmental law and policy. This conference, held in 1992, established critical frameworks for sustainable development, influencing EU regulatory measures on environmental protection and climate change. The outcomes, notably the Agenda 21 and the Rio Declaration, have been integrated into EU legislation, guiding member states in their environmental governance. As a redirect term, it underscores the importance of the preferred term in legal discourse, facilitating clarity in discussions surrounding international environmental commitments and EU compliance.
